intro: Klasea chinensis, commonly known as Chinese klasea, is a flowering plant native to eastern Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring slender stems and compound leaves with a fern-like appearance. Its small, yellowish-white flowers appear in umbels, typical of the Apiaceae family. Klasea chinensis is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has been used in traditional Chinese medicine.
